question: In which year did the United Nations General assembly adopt the universal declaration of human rights
explanation: The Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR) is a historic document that was adopted by the United Nations General Assembly at its third session on 10 December 1948 as Resolution 217 at the Palais de Chaillot in Paris, France.

question: The following cadre of students are the main target for campus cult membership except?
explanation: Students of highest standards of integrity, sound judgment and a strong moral compass are not succeptible to cult membership.

question: The National Agency for the Food and Drug Administration and Control (NAFDAC) was established in?
explanation: NAFDAC was established by Decree 15 of 1993 with the purpose of preventing the circulation of illicit and counterfeit products in Nigeria under the country's health and safety law.

question: National Agency for the Prohibition of traffic in persons (NAPTIP) is an initiative of
explanation: The National Agency for the Prohibition of Trafficking in Persons is a law enforcement agency of the Federal Government of Nigeria, founded in 2003 in order to combat human trafficking and other similar human rights violations.
options: United states agency for international development
women trafficking and child labour eradication foundation
United nations office on drugs and crime.

question: An enabling environment created to help an individual have effective control of his/her situation is known as
explanation: empowerment is a process where adults, children and young people are encouraged to take charge of their lives. They do this by addressing their situation and then take action in order to improve their access to resources and transform their consciousness through their beliefs, values, and attitudes.

question: World AIDS day is observed on?
explanation: World AIDS Day takes place on the 1st December each year. It's an opportunity for people worldwide to unite in the fight against HIV, to show support for people people living with the virus.

question: In order to avoid undue interference in the process of governance, there should be
explanation: Separation of powers is a doctrine of constitutional law under which the three branches of government (executive, legislative, and judicial) are kept separate. This is also known as the system of checks and balances, because each branch is given certain powers so as to check and balance the other branches.
options: clear cut separation of governmental power
proper fusion of governmental powers and functions
more roles for traditional rulers in the governmental process
additional responsibility for local government council

question: Red-tapism is one of the shortcomings of
explanation: red-tapism - Behaviour, practices, or attitudes associated with an excessive adherence to official rules and formalities. A bureaucratic system and it is associated with the public service

question: An ideology that aims at promoting national conciousness and identity is
explanation: Nationalism is an ideology and movement characterized by the promotion of the interests of a particular nation, especially with the aim of gaining and maintaining the nation's sovereignty over its homeland.

question: Human rights are described as inviolable mainly because they are
explanation: Iviolable means something that should never to be broken, infringed, or dishonoured. And that's why human rights are enforceable everywhere.
options: not to be unnecessarily taken away

explanation: To maintain law and order, there must be some rules that should be followed. Whoever will break any of these rules is therefore required to get punished or diciplined as the case maybe. By doing this, we will maintain law and order even in our society.
options: enforcement of the rules and regulations
use of divide and rule policy

question: A responsible parent is someone who
explanation: A responsible parenthood is simply defined as the “will” and ability of parents to respect and do the needs and aspirations of the family and children. It is the ability of a parent to detect the need, happiness and desire of the children and helping them to become responsible and reasonable children.
options: cares and provides for the children
indulges the children because of love
works in order to receive salary

question: Which of the following is not a function of the National Drug Law Enforcement agency (NDLEA)
explanation: The National Drug Law Enforcement Agency is a Federal agency in Nigeria charged with eliminating the growing, processing, manufacturing, selling, exporting, and trafficking of hard drugs.
options: arresting, investigating and prosecuting drug traffickers
applying and implementing all drug laws
undertaking the registration of campaigns on drug trafficking
carrying out enlightenment campaigns on drug traficking

question: Which of the following statement best describes human trafficking
explanation: human trafficking is  the action or practice of illegally transporting people from one country or area to another, typically for the purposes of forced labour or sexual exploitation.
options: recruitment of youths as casual workers
desperate desire by youths to travel abroad
buying and selling of humans for selfish purpose
transportation of goods of goods and services through human portal

question: An individual who finds it difficult to control in-take of drugs is known as
explanation: Drug addiction, also called substance use disorder, is a disease that affects a person's brain and behavior and leads to an inability to control the use of a legal or illegal drug or medication. Substances such as alcohol, marijuana and nicotine also are considered drugs.

question: A very important segment of the society which is distinct from government, business and home is the
explanation: Civil society can be understood as the "third sector" of society, distinct from government and business, and including the family and the private sphere.

question: HIV/AIDS is generally described as terminal in nature because it is
explanation: A terminal illness is a disease that cannot be cured or treated (for an improved prognosis) and is thus likely to cause death within no more than a few years. HIV/AIDS is a terminal illness if one does not have access to care and/or is non compliant with his or her medical therapy.

question: Inter-communal relationship is best described as
explanation: Inter communal relationship is a relationship which exist between two or more communities. A good inter communal relationship will work to promote peace and harmony among the communities and bring people of various communities together.
options: the interaction between individuals, groups or organisations with common aspiration
the interaction between individuals and professionals in a social setting
loyalty to community leaders so as to achieve rapid communal development
respect for collective national symbols in order to foster nationalistic feeling

question: A situation whereby someone is obliged to inform a superior about his decision and actions for the purpose of control is
explanation: Accountability is staying responsible for one's action and allowing another person to keep on the right track.

Association and affiliation two or more people is called
explanation: Interpersonal relationships are social associations, connections, or affiliations between two or more people. They vary in differing levels of intimacy and sharing, implying the discovery or establishment of common ground, and may be centered around something(s) shared in common.

question:
A bill passed by the national assembly requires the assent of the president before it becomes law. The law can be declared null and void by the court of law.

explanation: The three arms of government are equal and exist to check the excesses of each other
options: supremacy of the judiciary over other arms of government
relationship among the arms of government
importance of the law makers in a democracy
fundamentals of the rule of law

question: The idea that ''Law should be impartial with the people who brake it'' implies
explanation: Equality before the law. Equality before the law, also known as equality under the law, equality in the eyes of the law, legal equality, or legal egalitarianism, is the principle that each independent being must be treated equally by the law (principle of isonomy) and that all are subject to the same laws of justice ( due process ).

question: The foreing policy objective of Nigeria as enrished in the 1999 constitution exclude the promotion of?
explanation: Nigeria's formal foreign policy objectives - as outlined in the 1999 Constitution - are the promotion and protection of national interest, African integration and unity, and international collaboration; in that order.

question: Democracy can promote national development
explanation: Democracy can promote development through a peaceful and productive society based on effective state institutions. Good governance in this sense means effective and efficient structures which provide optimal support to citizens in leading a safe and productive life in line with their desires and opportunities.

question: A major civil society group which campaigned against military rule prior to the advent of the fourth republic in Nigeria is the
explanation: The Campaign for Democracy (CD), organized in the 1990s is a Nigerian civil society group that advocates for greater democracy in Nigeria and called for an end to the country's military dictatorship

question: Which of the following functions is not performed by the public service commission
explanation: The public service commission Promote and maintain the highest levels of integrity, impartiality, accountability and leadership across the government sector. Improve the capability of the governmentsector to provide strategic and innovative policy advice, implement the decisions of the Government and meet public expectations.
options: evaluating the performance of ministries and departments
preparing the annual budget and assenting to it

question: Democracy is yet to take firm root in Africa because
explanation:
Factors affecting democracy in Africa

  • Corruption and Inefficiency. In many democratic countries, the political leaders, officers, tend to be corrupt, dishonest and inefficient.
  • Role of Anti-Social Elements. 
  • Growing Economic and Social Inequalities Among People. 
  • Casteism and Communalism.
options: African leaders are not experienced enough
most African leaders detest the will of the people
it is expensive system of government

question: Which of the following is a major challenge to civil society in Nigeria
explanation: The development of civil society in Nigeria seems to have been inhibited by a long history of authoritarianism; by colonial heritage and a history of limited economic growth, by religious traditions; by legal structures that often placed obstacles in the way of civil society formation; and by development policies.

question: Nationalism ensures the following except
explanation: nationalism is the identification with one's own nation and support for its interests, especially to the exclusion or detriment of the interests of other nations.

question: Justice demands that people should always do what is
explanation: Justice is the quality of being fair and reasonable. Doing what is consistently necessary

question: Orderliness in the society is good mainly because it
explanation: Orderliness simply means a situation whereby citizens do things rights and in obedience to the rules and regulations of the society. It promotes peaceful coexistence as everyone does what they are meant to do, when it should be done and and deligently.
